resources.string:
Is the movement of the body in a rhythmic way, usually to music and within given space, for the purpose of expressing and idea or emotion , releasing energy, or simply taking delight in movement. 
 
Is an expresssion of the body, following rhythmic patterns and is accompanied by music. From Primitive man expressing emotions ins such events such as birth, death marriage, war, among other things, dance has evolved to modern forms of social gatherings. 
 
 is one of the oldest and most popular forms of exercise.

A major form of religious ritual and social expression with primitive cultures. A way of expressing and tribal unity and strength.
 
 An approach for courtship and mating 
 
 A means of worship communication and therapeutic experience.
Become a fullblown and was richly recorded. It is also reflected in wall paintings, reliefs and in literary record in hieroglyphs. \n \n As a medium of religious expression.
Is an to military education, And as a form of entertainment display
In the Roman era They stopped valuing such qualities in arts as the nations grew wealthy and powerful. The romans ceased to create and perform within the arts themselves.
The Christian Fathers approved the used of dance, provided that its form and intent were holy and profound. As dances then became part of worships and church activities

They performed dance in the village squares to welcome the feudal lords in the castles. 
 
 The common people amused themselves by doing dances that were social in character. it is also the beginning of Social Dancing.
 
 Two types of dance performed by peasants. 
 
 Round dance: dancers hold each other by hand forming a long chain and move about in an open closed circle. 
 
 Couple Dance: It was not as popular than round dance as it was considered scandalous when first seen.

Was wholly accepted in courts as a gradual increases of the capitalist class produced patrons of learning and arts in Europe. 

 Dance and art in general gains impetus 

 The entertainers now become valuable appendage to the courts of Italy and France.
More court dances performed by nobility came about as well as rise of art in ballet in Italy and France. \n\n Several other dance forms continued to sprout and spread across several countries.

Develop cardiovascular endurance
 Improves coordination, balance, flexibility and body composition.
 Lower risk cardiovascular disease.\m Lower body mass index.
 Lower resting heart.
 Improves lipid metabolism.
 Enable joint mobility.
 Helps improve and maintain bone density.

Help keep the brain sharp.
 Decrease incidence of Dementia and Alzheimers Disease.
 Decrease depressive symptoms.
 Increase self-esteem and improves body image.
 Aids in releasing emotional and physical tension.

Give sense of togetherness within group.
 Encourages positive social interaction and interpersonal relationship in group.
 Contributes to the individuals for self-actualization in society.
Are dances indigenous communities that show cultural traits of people i specific time and place.\n Customs and traditions through dance steps and costumes are preserved in traditional dance.

Ritual Dance.

Life Cycle Dance.

Occupational Dance.
 Occupational dance is a form of art that expresses the hardworking value of Filipinos. from different places in the country by showing their local culture and livelihood. The. theme of the folk dance would differ depending on where they live - near the seas, in. the fields, by the mountains, etc.

According to geographical locations, Folk Dances can be:/n National Dances with common basic movements, with slight variations.

 Local/Regional
 Dances that are unique to certain localities only.

Modern Dance: is the style of dancing where dancers are free to express their feelings through movements.

 Contemporary Dance:
 incorporate the strong legwork and balance off ballet and trunk movements of modern dance.
A combination of cheering and dancing.\n\n Components include the mandatory cheer as well aas number of gymnastics and acrobatic moves such as cartwheels and hand springs
HipHop:\n is a dance style performed to hip-hop music and usually dance in the street.\n it includes a wide range of styles primarily breaking, locking and popping.

It was taken from the Italian word "BALLARE" meaning TO DANCE, and "BALLO" referring to DANCES PERFORMED IN BALLROOMS.\n combinations of arts of dancing poetry, music, painting.\n An artistic, programmatic, scenic dance accompanied by music.

Is a set of partner dances, which are enjoyed both socially and competitively around the world.\n because of its performance and entertainment aspects, ballroom dance is also widely enjoyed on stage, film and televisions.

Are cultural dances performed to the strong beats of percussion instruments by a community of people sharing the same culture usually done in honor of a patron saint or as a thanksgiving for a bountiful harvest.\n Festival Dances may be religious or secular in nature.
